skillTree.localised_description: A general's horse can be their most trusted and daring companion. Just don't name him 'Daisy'.
An Imperial pegasus is a noble, winged steed, intelligent and loyal.
Gausser leads the hardened Nordland armies against all foes from atop his enormous black and white Imperial Griffon, Schwartzmere. Each foe slain is one less to defile this mighty province.

effects.description: Melee attack: +6 for Theoderic Gausser (when riding Schwartzmere)
Melee defence: +6 for Theoderic Gausser (when riding Schwartzmere)
Missile resistance: 10% for Theoderic Gausser (when riding Schwartzmere)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
The relentless drive and fury of the Hammer, harnessed for the protection of this ward’s bearer.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Nordland Marines are resented in many seaside communities. When raiders attack, however, these same citizens are quick to accept the aid of battle-hardened Marines.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain: +25% for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +10 for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs. Infantry: +8 for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: 15% for Free Company Militia units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many sea fortresses and watch-towers line the coast of Nordland, as raiders from across the Sea of Claws are an all too common threat that can't be ignored without dire consequences.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +10% when fighting against Norscan Tribes
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +8 when fighting against Norscan Tribes
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +10 when fighting against Norsca
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Elector Counts of Nordland have accumulated an impressive collection of titles and claims over the millennia, which if enforced, would make them rulers of the entire northern portions of the Empire. Reality has a way of foiling the most grandiose ambitions, however, and the Count's rule extends to barely half of the lands he claimed.

effects.description:
Income from raiding: +10%
	(armies in local province)

Income from sacking and looting settlements: +15%
	(armies in local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Since its incoporation as a province, Nordland is famous for housing the Imperial Navy and its heavily tolled coastal roads, which provide both safe passage for rich merchants heading towards the city of Marienburg and the main source of income that funds it's economy.

Gausser is a fearsome warrior-lord who embodies his people's tenacity and war-like nature to its very core. As Elector Count, he also holds the title of Prince of Marienburg, however he is forbidden to enter the city on pain of death.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: Hand-to-hand combat is a lethal match of cut and thrust. However, it’s not all about offensive strikes; parries and other defensive moves can also win the day.
Some creatures charge home with such fury that the very ground shakes beneath their feet.
Full-Plate armour protects the wearer from head-to-foot. Many such suits are blessed or imbued with arcane abilities.
The scars on this storied warrior reveal a veteran of many battles, a being not easy to kill and one worthy of respect and fear.
A deadly blade is especially lethal when in the hands of this master death-maker, killer and slaughterer!
From one bloodied, lifeless corpse to the next, this one is always looking for the next adversary to best.
Such is their power and ferocity, a wound-maker will ravage the foe, cutting and pulverising until there is only one exit - death.
This warrior is one with their blade; it is an extension of their will, making them a worthy foe in combat.
The iron will and indomitable presence of this leader ensures their followers remain steadfast when facing peril.
A blade that sings in defence will not let its wielder be penetrated.
There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: “We march to war for our Emperor, and Sigmar, our saviour and lord.”

effects.description:
Melee defence: +4 for Spearmen, Swordsmen, Flagellants, and Halberdiers units

skillTree.localised_description: These steeds are bred for speed and war, but foremost it is their gallop which marks them out.

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord expects his men to practice the disciplines of the Pistolkorps, and all be expert marksmen.

skillTree.localised_description: Honest Empire-forged steel is all a state trooper could ask when confronting the myriad foes in battle.

skillTree.localised_description: The frontline will either make or break you. Those who survive become the backbone of any army.

skillTree.localised_description: Some men grow to relish war, dulled to the pain and living solely for the thrill of the kill.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
The presence of this Lord ensures a measure of calm, reducing panic and desertion amongst followers.

effects.description:
Attrition: -15% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -25% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -35% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.

As an elected governing official of the Empire, an Elector Count has the power and authority to raise troops from his home province. In times of need, or if a regiment is being raised by the right individual, the Count may grant his favor to a unit.
"The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using the Underway, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: "Ever thought about joining the Elector's troops, chief? You'd make a good soldier alright."

factionEffects.localised_description: Theodoric Gausser is the Elector Count of Nordland, the only Imperial province with a coastline. It is a wild and dangerous place, both on land and sea. It is with these troubles on his worried brow that Theodoric Gausser rules his province. Such an embattered land has led to a hardy folk, and Gausser is certainly among them. He leads the hardened Nordland armies against all foes from atop his enormous black and white Imperial Griffin, Schwartzmere. Each foe slain is one less to defile this mighty province.

effects.description: Starts with a defensive alliance with Laurelorn

Control: +2 for every concurrent war with a neighbouring faction
	(all provinces)

items.colour_text: The tough, scaly hide of the Sea Dragon provides excellent protection against all manner of blows.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Theoderic Gausser or known more formally as Elector Count Theoderic Gausser, Grand Baron of Nordland, Prince of Salzenmund, Lord of Laurelorn, Duke of Marienburg, and Terror of the Norscans. Yes, that is a lot of titles.

effects.description:
Leadership: +1 for every concurrent war
	(all units in army)
